name: Pope Benedict XII
summary: Benedict XII, born Jacques Fournier, was Pope from 1334 to 1342. He was the third Avignon pope during the Avignon Papacy. A Cistercian monk before his election, he was known for his simplicity and efforts to reform the religious orders, particularly the Franciscans and Dominicans. He tried but failed to return the papacy to Rome. He condemned the mystical teachings of Meister Eckhart. He is remembered for his attempts at reform and his theological learning.
